result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.   Clerk: EZ.  (15CM41; 15CM131 Br. 1; 15CM444 Br. 4; 15CM1103 Br. 2)  Court dismissed case upon plea to 15CM1103. .Court does not reverse any of the bail forfeitures.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CM131 & 15CM41 Br. 1; 15CM1103 Br. 2; 15CM444 Br. 4)  Counsel's first appearance and anticipate global resolution.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Not possess any firearms; No contact with victim - Hampton Inn Suites; Def refused to sign bond
Hearing on July 19, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew Edward Weil by Atty. deJunco.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.   Clerk: EZ.  (15CM131 & 15CM41 Br. 1; 15CM444 Br . 4; 15CM1103 Br. 2)  Atty. deJunco advises the defendant has been reevaluated and Atty. Matthew Weil will be reappointed.  State request $5,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. deJunco states defendant could reside with his father and defendant wishes to address the court.  Defendant makes statements.  Defendant states missed court as had no place to stay and left the state for a period of time and request to resolve the matters.   Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
in custody
